simple.gui.config
Class ConfigPage

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  simple.gui.config.ConfigPage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
WizardPanel
public abstract class ConfigPage
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This abstract class gives general implementation to create "plug-in" configuration panels.
Created: 2008
depends on SJOptionPane, SwingFactory

Author:
Kenneth Pierce
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ConfigPage

public ConfigPage()
Creates a JPanel using BorderLayout laid out like so:
 .___________________________.
 ||       JPanel main       ||
 ||                         ||
 ||_________________________||
 ||       JPanel bottom     ||
 ||___________[save][cancel]||
 Save and Cancel are setup to call saveChanges() and
 undoChanges() repsectively.
All other constructors defined in this class call this constructor.
Calls init() which should be overridden to set-up the components used for settings.

ConfigPage

public ConfigPage(java.util.Properties settings)
Calls ConfigPanel() and setProperties(settings).

Parameters:
settings -

ConfigPage

protected ConfigPage(boolean isDoubleBuffered)
Calls ConfigPage() and sets this JPanel as double buffered.
Overrides JPanel.JPanel(boolean).

Parameters:
isDoubleBuffered -

protected ConfigPage(java.awt.LayoutManager layout,
                     boolean isDoubleBuffered)

Overrides JPanel.JPanel(java.awt.LayoutManager, boolean).

setProperties

protected void setProperties(java.util.Properties props)
Using the names gotten from Names.getNames(), gets the values from props and puts them using setProperty.

props - HashMap containing the values.

public java.util.Enumeration<?> getPropertyNames()

init

protected abstract void init(java.util.Properties properties)
This method is called by the constructor and should be overriden by the subclass to setup the panel.

saveChanges

protected abstract void saveChanges()
This method is called when the save button is pressed.
It should save the current values using setProperty().
Can be used for validation.

undoChanges

protected abstract void undoChanges()
This method is called when the cancel button is pressed.
It should undo any changes using getProperty().

saveProperties

public void saveProperties(java.io.OutputStream out,
                           java.lang.String comment)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Saves the current settings to an XML file.

Parameters:
out - OutputStream to save the settings to.
comment -
Throws:
java.io.IOException

loadProperties

public void loadProperties(java.io.InputStream in)
                    throws java.util.InvalidPropertiesFormatException,
                           java.io.IOException
Loads settings from a XML file.

Parameters:
in - InputStream to read the settings from.
Throws:
java.util.InvalidPropertiesFormatException
java.io.IOException

getNames

showError

protected void showError(javax.swing.JComponent target,
                         java.lang.String message)
Shows a dialog box with the set message. Focus is given to the target when the dialog box is closed.

Parameters:
target - Component to give focus to.
message - Message to display.
